content.title: ReferenceError: Cannot access 'updateFile' before initialization
content.body:
View details in Rollbar: [https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/13](https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/13)

```

ReferenceError: Cannot access 'updateFile' before initialization
  File "C:\Users\alpha\youtube-public\src\index.js", line 255, in Object.<anonymous>
  File "node:internal/modules/cjs/loader", line 1484, in Module._compile
  File "node:internal/modules/cjs/loader", line 1564, in Module._extensions..js
  File "node:internal/modules/cjs/loader", line 1295, in Module.load
  File "node:internal/modules/cjs/loader", line 1111, in Module._load
  File "node:electron/js2c/node_init", line 2, in c._load
  File "node:internal/modules/esm/translators", line 350, in cjsLoader
  File "node:internal/modules/esm/translators", line 286, in ModuleWrap.<anonymous>
  File "node:internal/modules/esm/module_job", line 234, in ModuleJob.run
  File "node:internal/modules/esm/loader", line 473, in async ModuleLoader.import
```
content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The `ReferenceError: Cannot access 'updateFile' before initialization` no longer occurs when `src/index.js` is executed.
The `updateFile` function is correctly initialized and accessible when called within `src/index.js`.
The application or module utilizing `src/index.js` starts and operates without encountering new errors after the fix.

details: The source code of `src/index.js` around line 255 to understand the declaration and usage context of the `updateFile` variable or function.

fileActions.explanation: To examine the code at line 255 and its surrounding context to identify why `updateFile` is being accessed before initialization.

fileActions.oldContent: /* Block of code showing where updateFile is used/declared incorrectly */
fileActions.newContent: /* Corrected block of code where updateFile is declared/initialized before use */
fileActions.explanation: To correct the declaration or initialization order of `updateFile` in `src/index.js` once the problematic code has been identified. The exact `oldContent` and `newContent` will be determined after reviewing the file.
